params.calls: An array of inputs for each call.
params.revertOnFail: If True then reverts after a failed call and stops doing further calls.

params.data: Additional abi encoded calldata that is passed to the new clone via `IMasterContract.init`.
params.masterContract: The address of the contract to clone.
params.useCreate2: Creates the clone by using the CREATE2 opcode, in this case `data` will be used as salt.

returns.cloneAddress: Address of the created clone contract.

params.amount: Token amount in native representation to deposit.
params.from: which account to pull the tokens.
params.share: Token amount represented in shares to deposit. Takes precedence over `amount`.
params.to: which account to push the tokens.

returns.shareOut: The deposited amount repesented in shares.

toAmount(uint256,uint256,bool).details: Helper function represent shares back into the `token` amount.

params.roundUp: If the result should be rounded up.

returns.amount: The share amount back into native representation.

toShare(uint256,uint256,bool).details: Helper function to represent an `amount` of `token` in shares.

params.roundUp: If the result `share` should be rounded up.

returns.share: The token amount represented in shares.

params.from: which user to pull the tokens.
params.to: which user to push the tokens.

params.from: which user to pull the tokens.
params.share: The amount of `token` in shares for each receiver in `tos`.

params.amount: of tokens. Either one of `amount` or `share` needs to be supplied.
params.from: which user to pull the tokens.
params.share: Like above, but `share` takes precedence over `amount`.
params.to: which user to push the tokens.

batch(bytes[],bool).notice: Allows batched call to self (this contract).

deploy(address,bytes,bool).notice: Deploys a given master Contract as a clone. Any ETH transferred with this call is forwarded to the new clone. Emits `LogDeploy`.

depositAsset(uint256,address,address,uin.notice: Deposit an amount of `token` represented in either `amount` or `share`.

masterContractOf(address).notice: Mapping from clone contracts to their masterContract.

permitToken(address,address,address,uint.notice: Call wrapper that performs `ERC20.permit` on `token`. Lookup `IERC20.permit`.

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.notice: The following safeTransfer functions are purely here to be EIP-1155 compliant. Using these in your protocol is NOT recommended as it opens up many attack vectors, such as reentrancy issues and denial of service?

transfer(uint256,address,address,uint256.notice: Transfer shares from a user account to another one.

transferMultiple(uint256,address,address.notice: Transfer shares from a user account to multiple other ones.

withdraw(uint256,address,address,uint256.notice: Withdraws an amount of `token` from a user account.

userdoc.notice: The YieldBox is a vault for tokens. The stored tokens can assigned to strategies. Yield from this will go to the token depositors. Any funds transfered directly onto the YieldBox will be lost, use the deposit function instead.

t_mapping(t_uint96,t_mapping(t_address,t.label: mapping(uint96 => mapping(address => mapping(contract IStrategy => mapping(uint256 => uint256))))
